abstract_summ: This study investigated the effects of temperature and relative humidity on daily new cases and daily new deaths of COVID-19, which has useful implications for policymakers and the public.However, about 93.5% cases of COVID-19 occurred between 10C to 160C and the average number of cases per day was lower in high temperature country than low temperature country with exceptions.A 1 °C increase in temperature was associated with a 3.08% (95% CI: 1.53%, 4.63%) reduction in daily new cases and a 1.19% (95% CI: 0.44%, 1.95%) reduction in daily new deaths, whereas a 1% increase in relative humidity was associated with a 0.85% (95% CI: 0.51%, 1.19%) reduction in daily new cases and a 0.51% (95% CI: 0.34%, 0.67%) reduction in daily new deaths.Log-linear generalized additive model was used to analyze the effects of temperature and relative humidity on daily new cases and daily new deaths of COVID-19, with potential confounders controlled for, including wind speed, median age of the national population, Global Health Security Index, Human Development Index and population density.Then, the generalized additive model was applied to explore the impact of temperature, humidity and diurnal temperature range on daily mortality of COVID-19.
title_summ: Role of meteorological temperature and relative humidity in the January-February 2020 propagation of 2019-nCoV in Wuhan, ChinaTemperature and relative humidity are not major contributing factor on the occurrence of COVID-19 pandemic: An observational study in 57 countriesMeteorological Conditions and Covid-19 in Large U.S. CitiesEffects of temperature variation and humidity on the mortality of COVID-19 in WuhanEffects of temperature variation and humidity on the death of COVID-19 in Wuhan, ChinaEffects of temperature and humidity on the daily new cases and new deaths of COVID-19 in 166 countries
title_abstract_phrases: Effects of temperature and humidity on the daily new cases and new deaths of COVID-19 in 166 countriesAbstract The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic is the defining global health crisis of our time and the greatest challenge facing the world.This study investigated the effects of temperature and relative humidity on daily new cases and daily new deaths of COVID-19, which has useful implications for policymakers and the public.However, about 93.5% cases of COVID-19 occurred between 10C to 160C and the average number of cases per day was lower in high temperature country than low temperature country with exceptions.In conclusion, lower temperature and higher wind speed/sky cover may be associated with higher Covid-19 prevalence, which should be confirmed by further epidemiological researches adjusting for various risk and protective factors (in addition to meteorological conditions) of Covid-19.Effects of temperature variation and humidity on the mortality of COVID-19 in WuhanObject Meteorological parameters are the important factors influencing the infectious diseases like severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS).A 1 °C increase in temperature was associated with a 3.08% (95% CI: 1.53%, 4.63%) reduction in daily new cases and a 1.19% (95% CI: 0.44%, 1.95%) reduction in daily new deaths, whereas a 1% increase in relative humidity was associated with a 0.85% (95% CI: 0.51%, 1.19%) reduction in daily new cases and a 0.51% (95% CI: 0.34%, 0.67%) reduction in daily new deaths.
